text: Borel may refer to: ==People== * Borel (author), 18th-century French playwright * Borel (1906–1967), pseudonym of the French actor Jacques Henri Cottance * Émile Borel (1871 – 1956), a French mathematician known for his founding work in the areas of measure theory and probability * Armand Borel (1923 – 2003), a Swiss mathematician * Mary Grace Borel (1915 – 1998), American socialite ==Places== * Borel, California, former community in Kern County * Borel (crater), a lunar crater, named after Émile Borel ==Mathematics== * Borel algebra, operating on Borel sets, named after Émile Borel, also: ** Borel measure, the measure on a Borel algebra * Borel distribution, a discrete probability distribution, also named after Émile Borel * Borel subgroup, in the theory of algebraic groups, named after Armand Borel ==Other uses== * Borel (surname), a surname * Etablissements Borel, an aircraft manufacturing company founded by Gabriel Borel ==See also== *Borrel *Borrell
title: Borel
